name: Ribbety Frog
description: Ribbety Frog is an interesting motorized toy, that possesses the characteristic movement of a frog. It is made with a combination of joinery methods: mortise-tenon connections, motorized and simple fixation of outer body parts with screws and other accessories. All the materials are present in the self-build kit, except the battery which is to be placed in the holder space given. An eco-friendly toy that is designed to encourage and support the curiosity of child. The working of Ribbety Frog explains the concept of motion through the 3D model for better understanding and application as well.
meta_description: A realistic fun frog in the form of a toy - the Ribbety Frog explains the movement of a frog through simple gears. It aids in a better understanding of phases and also provides an opportunity to modify the frog's motion by making small alterations in the gear train.
short_description:
Ever wondered can a cycle moves backward through pedals? What is actually playing a role in the movement of objects, keeping them in contact with the surface? What kind of energy is given to them? Do they even require energy?

Don't worry, MakenBreak's Ribbety Frog is here to introduce you to this world of mechanics which focuses on the motion of the rabbit and its interdependencies. Ribbety Frog is a smaller-scale version of HUMANZEE. Do visit the product here.

We at MakenBreak always want the children to get closer to science through day-to-day realities and movements. So here comes up the replica movement of a frog - RIBBETY FROG!! It is one of the CUBE Toys where an attempt of aligning the dynamics of mechanics with living organisms is made. As the child begins to build the toy through mortise tenon joints and finishes it, there are four major phases that the kid has dwelled upon - Concepts, Satisfaction, Skills, and Multiple Intelligence.

Ribbety Frog explains the concept of the phase difference through gears and screws. The functioning frog demonstrates real-life phenomena like friction and motion by replicating the toad movement. The notion of current flow through the power supply is what helps the frog in achieving speed and distance. Academically, a child isn't expected to get used to such concepts at an early age, but why not try to connect them to the real world through a simple DIY Toy.

Kids' mesmerizing eyes and exciting smiles with a touch of curiosity surely demand to try more things similar to the one which they have just accomplished. While playing and learning motor skills, a sense of satisfaction is truly achieved. As the matter of fact, all of it is achieved through a pack consisting of 35 precision-cut engineered wood pieces, a maker guide, and other accessories that are required to compile and complete the entire model except the battery.

We at MakenBreak adhere to focusing on skills and multiple intelligences in a child's life. Hence, Ribbety Frog automatically guides a child's brain toward lateral thinking and get a sense of design as they begin to construct and join the pieces. This is possible only when there is concentration and keen observation; resulting in a creative mindset. All of such skills are achievable and enjoyable when looked at a kid's point of interest and enthusiasm to try new things with the idea of hands-on-problem solving. This is the point that gives us an opportunity to imbibe and improve their intelligences. The journey where the child tries to figure out what, where, and how the pieces are connected, contributes to expanding their reasonable thinking capacity and thereafter improving Logical-Mathematical and Kinaesthetic Multiple Intelligences. Even their Visual-Spatial, and Existential Multiple Intelligences are elevated once they sense the whole play through their eyes by grasping the arrangement of the whole. Not to mention that, since they are being connected to the aspects of realistic animal-like motions, their Naturalistic Intelligence is also increased.

On one hand, the changing of phases helps in defining the toad frog, while on the other, children get more enthusiastic and interested in practical functioning, self-built, CUBE, STEM DIY Toy even in the world of mechanics.

real_life_connect:
Frogs are known for their ability to leap and jump. Long-legged frogs use quick, powerful jumps to get away from predators. However, not all frogs can jump. Frogs with shorter legs walk, crawl or hop short distances.

The frog’s hind legs are equipped with powerful muscles that launch it upwards. The back feet stay on the ground for as long as possible while its body straightens out. In flight, it folds it front legs against its torso and fully stretches the back legs.
